result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:15 PM Defendant Connor J Smith in court. Special appearance by Attorney Luke K Harrison in court for Connor J Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Public Defender has not appointed counsel for the defendant and requests more time to do so. The matter is adjourned.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Connor J Smith
Current: 1228 S. 13th Street, Apt. A, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 10-13-2022)
Prior: 2014 S 9Th St, Manitowoc, WI 54220

RE: Physical Abuse of an Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm on 10-06-2022.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 10-06-2022
Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of Physical Abuse to Elderly and Disorderly Conduct - DVO.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 10-24-2022 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 1.  Bail is set at $1,000 recognizance bond with the conditions that he is to have no contact with 2014 S. 9th Street, Two Rivers, WI, he is to have no contact with K.K.K. DOB: 11-23-1952, M.R.S. DOB: 02-07-2007 or any premises they may occupy. Defendant must provide an address to the Clerk of Court Office, in writing, within 48 hours of release.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
